text: The Japan Cup is the most important horse race in Japan. It is held at the end of November in the Tokyo Racecourse. The race is 2400 metres long and the winner gets about ¥533 million (about US $4.6 million) as an award (the highest reward for horse racing in the world). == Winners == Year Winner Age Jockey Trainer Owner Time 1981 Mairzy Doates 5 Cash Asmussen John Fulton Arno Schefler 2:25.3 1982 Half Iced 3 Don MacBeth Stanley M.
